page_analysis.text_content:
Noise-producing equipment site planning

• May not be located in front, rear, or interior-side yards.
• May encroach into street-side yard up to 6' (Fig 27 C below)
• All service equip. must meet the City's Noise Ordinance in Chapter 9.10 of the Municipal Code.

• Replacement of equipment shall conform to this section where feasible.
• Must be insulated and housed, however, Planning Dept. can waive this requirement if equipment is located in buildable area and a combination of noise specifications, location, and/or other screening or buffering will assure compliance with the City's Noise Ordinance at the nearest lot line.

Fig 27 Examples of site planning solutions for noise-producing equipment

A Pool equipment
• Pool equip. is within buildable area even though there is room for it behind the garage/poolhouse in the required rear yard.
• Air conditioning equip. is located in an out-of-the-way niche maintaining the required 10' min. clearance for the driveway

B Pool equipment & AC unit
• Pool equip. is located within buildable area even though there is room for it in the poolhouse in the required rear yard.
• Air conditioning equip. is located within buildable area behind the house. There is not enough room along the interior side of the house.

C Generator & AC unit
• Air conditioning equip. is located in street side yard in compliance with the regulations. Note that it may not encroach into the front or rear yards.
• Generator is located within buildable area.

Key
— Curb
--- Lot line
⊔⊔⊔ Sidewalk
--- Required setbacks
□ Buildable area
■ Dwelling/parking
P Pool equip.
AC Air conditioning equip.
G Generator

33

visual_elements.description: Three site plan diagrams (A, B, C) showing different configurations for placing noise-producing equipment on residential lots. Each diagram shows a property layout with main dwelling, garage/poolhouse, and various equipment placements marked with symbols P (pool equipment), AC (air conditioning), and G (generator). Diagrams include property lines, setbacks, buildable areas, and required clearances.
visual_elements.location: Middle and bottom portion of page

visual_elements.description: Key showing symbols used in diagrams including curb (solid line), lot line (dashed line), sidewalk (hatched pattern), required setbacks (dashed line), buildable area (light gray), dwelling/parking (dark gray), and equipment symbols P, AC, and G

sections: Fig 27 Examples of site planning solutions for noise-producing equipment

additional_notes: Page appears to be from a technical planning manual with clear diagrams and specifications
Text quality is good and legible throughout

qualifiers.text: however, Planning Dept. can waive this requirement if equipment is located in buildable area and a combination of noise specifications, location, and/or other screening or buffering will assure compliance with the City's Noise Ordinance at the nearest lot line
even though there is room for it behind the garage/poolhouse in the required rear yard
even though there is room for it in the poolhouse in the required rear yard

conditions.text: May not be located in front, rear, or interior-side yards
May encroach into street-side yard up to 6'
All service equip. must meet the City's Noise Ordinance in Chapter 9.10 of the Municipal Code
Replacement of equipment shall conform to this section
Air conditioning equip. is located in an out-of-the-way niche maintaining the required 10' min. clearance for the driveway
Pool equip. is within buildable area
Air conditioning equip. is located within buildable area behind the house
Air conditioning equip. is located in street side yard in compliance with the regulations. Note that it may not encroach into the front or rear yards
conditions.threshold_value: street side yard placement without front/rear encroachment

conditions.text: Generator is located within buildable area

logical_relationships.expression: Equipment must not be in prohibited yards AND must meet noise ordinance
Replacement equipment shall conform to section, must be insulated and housed, however Planning Dept. can waive if conditions met

execution_sequence.action: Verify equipment is not located in prohibited yard areas
Check if encroachment into street-side yard is within 6 feet limit
Ensure all service equipment meets City's Noise Ordinance requirements
For replacement equipment, verify conformance to section requirements
Verify equipment is insulated and housed, or evaluate waiver conditions
